In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for `clean_column` function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
In this code, we use built-in functions like `replace`, `lowercase` and `strip`. The `replace` function replaces the matched pattern with another string. In our case, it replaces one or more spaces or hyphens with an underscore. 

The `lowercase` function converts all characters in a string to lowercase and `strip` function removes leading and trailing whitespaces from a string. 

This function takes a string as input (`col`) and returns a cleaned up version of the same string.
